helloldap.cli¶

Tools to assist CLI scripts.

helloldap.cli.add_parser_args(parser, which=None)[source]¶

Adds default arguments to given parser instance.

Parameters:
  • parser – Instance of a parser
  • which – List of 2-Tuples. 1st elem tells which argument to add, 2nd elem tells requiredness.
helloldap.cli.build_rc(args, default_rc, config='config')[source]¶

Builds map of settings.

Settings are taken from default_rc, optionally overridden by settings in the config file specified on command line, optionally overridden by explicit command line arguments.

Parameters:
  • args – Namespace with CLI arguments
  • default_rc – Dict with default settings
  • config – Key in args that gives path to external config file
Returns:

ChainMap with settings
helloldap.cli.init_cli_locale(locale_name, detach_stdout=True)[source]¶

Initialises CLI locale and encoding.

Sets a certain locale. Ensures that output is correctly encoded, whether it is send directly to a console or piped.

Parameters:
  • locale_name – A locale name, e.g. “de_DE.utf8”.
  • detach_stdout – If True (default), and we are not in a TTY (meaning, output is piped somewhere), we replace original STDOUT with a writer from the codecs module. If you do not want that (e.g. in PyCharm test runner), set this to False.
Returns:

active locale as 2-tuple (lang_code, encoding)
